bug.short_desc: Complete dark transition between day and dusk
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The transition from day to dusk in the animated wallpaper is completely darkened.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 26.2.1
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. 2. 3.
Actual results: Tranition is completely darkened
Expected results: Tranisiton should be subtle smooth
Additional info: Dusk part of animated wallpaper will need adjustment.

With the animated wallpaper, I also encountered the case where before 9:00 I had the normal bright version of the wallpaper, and then it became 100% purely black at 9:00 sharp (ie. as if there was no wallpaper anymore).

(In reply to Gwendal from comment #2) > With the animated wallpaper, I also encountered the case where before 9:00 I > had the normal bright version of the wallpaper, and then it became 100% > purely black at 9:00 sharp (ie. as if there was no wallpaper anymore).
Strange. That is not a normal behaviour from the transition unless it is somewhat broken. I will take a look.

After debugging the issue with Gnome team, it turned out a bug with Mutter having an unexpected behaviour leading to a blank while in the transition. Assigning the issue to the right component and attach the upstream report.
f26-backgrounds-26.2.2-1.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

As noted by someone else on bodhi[0], this bug still exists in f26-backgrounds-26.2.2-1.
I have discovered that if all wallpapers are converted from PNG to JPEG format, the transitions work as expected. Indeed, the default GNOME animated background and previous Fedora animated backgrounds all used JPEG images, so this is likely to be an issue with GNOME's handling of transitions with PNG images.
